articles.title: FM Spokesman Denounces U.S. State Department's "2016 International Religious Freedom Report"
articles.content:
FM Spokesman Denounces U.S. State Department's "2016 International Religious Freedom Report"
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA Thursday as regards the fact that the U.S. State Department faulted the DPRK in its "2016 International Religious Freedom Report":
					 In the report on August 15 the U.S. State Department slandered the DPRK again.
					
					 The rhetoric about "religious freedom" touted by the U.S. is a means for creating pretexts for aggression and interference in sovereign states and for this it is denounced and rejected by many countries around the world.
					
					 The report which found fault with the DPRK does not deserve even a passing note as it is a desperate effort of those driven into a tight corner in the political and military stand-off with the DPRK.
					
					 What can never be tolerated is that the report slandered the Juche idea, the eternal guiding idea of the Workers' Party of Korea, and the socialist system, the lifeline of the Korean people.
					
					 The reality in which the DPRK is enjoying the new improvement of the overall state might and strategic position despite the unprecedented sanctions and pressure is a demonstration of the validity and vitality of the great Juche idea and Korean-style socialist system.
					
					 The U.S. provocative acts coming from all directions even over the religious issue of the DPRK at a time when the confrontation between the DPRK and the U.S. has been strained to the extremes will incur a due price.
					
					 The U.S. had better immediately stop arrogant provocative acts and unilateral pressure on the DPRK but pay heed to the warning that it should no longer provoke the DPRK.

articles.title: Korean Jurists Committee Term UNSC's "Sanctions Resolution" against DPRK Illegal
articles.content:
Korean Jurists Committee Term UNSC's "Sanctions Resolution" against DPRK Illegal
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The Korean Jurists Committee Thursday issued a statement terming as illegal the anti-DPRK "sanctions resolution" cooked up by the U.S. by abusing the UN Security Council over its test-launch of ICBM Hwasong-14.
					 The U.S. fabricated the unprecedented hash "sanctions resolution" which categorically cut off normal trade activities and economic exchange of the DPRK, the statement said, adding it is an unethical criminal act which contradicts paragraph 2, Article 1 of "International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights" which provides for not depriving a sovereign state of means of existence, and the act which runs counter to internationally recognized peremptory norm.
					
					 The UN Security Council is not an exception in the application of the peremptory norm, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 This being a hard reality, the UN Security Council has systematically fabricated the anti-DPRK "sanctions resolution" violating the rights to existence and development from 2006.
					
					 In particular, the anti-DPRK "sanctions resolution" 2371 which was fabricated under the pretext of the DPRK's test-launch of ICBM is aimed to completely prevent the DPRK's economic development and improvement of the people's living standard. Therefore, this is the criminal act fundamentally detrimental to peremptory norm.
					
					 Article 53 of the "Vienna Convention on Treaties" which stipulates the legal acts of states and international organizations says that "a treaty is void if, at the time of its conclusion, it conflicts with a peremptory norm of general international law". This goes to clearly prove that all the anti-DPRK "sanctions resolution" of the UNSC are null and void as they have systematically violated the DPRK's rights to existence and development. 
					
					 The statement stressed that all the anti-DPRK "sanctions resolution" fabricated by the U.S. so far by abusing the UNSC should be immediately annulled and the U.S. should pay a high price for the crimes it committed against our state and people.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Foreign Figures Participating in 5th International Festival in Praise of Great Persons of Mt Paektu
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Foreign Figures Participating in 5th International Festival in Praise of Great Persons of Mt Paektu
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday met and had a talk with foreign personages who are participating in the 5th International Festival in Praise of the Great Persons of Mt Paektu at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
					 Present there were lawmaker Madav Kumar Nepal who is former prime minister of Nepal and honorary chairman of the International Preparatory Committee for the Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, Peter Woods, ambassador of the United Cities and Local Governments-Asia Pacific, Damian Ogbonna, national chairman of the People's Progressive Party of Nigeria, Helmi El Hadidi, chairman of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization, Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, Victor Petrov, chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, and Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, vice-chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt, who are co-chairpersons of the International Preparatory Committee for the Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, and other personages from different countries, regions and international democratic organizations.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Indonesia
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Indonesia
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Joko Widodo, president of Indonesia, on the occasion of the 72nd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger and wished the president and people of Indonesia bigger success in the work for the country's socio-economic development and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Gabon
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Gabon
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Ali Bongo Ondimba, president of Gabon, on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields and wished the president of Gabon greater success in his work to achieve the country's political stability and socio-economic prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Indonesian FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Indonesian FM
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho Thursday sent a message of greeting to  Retno Lestari Priansari Marsudi, foreign minister of Indonesia, on the occasion of the 72nd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger by their common efforts.

articles.title: DPRK Government's Statement Distributed as UN General Assembly and UNSC Official Document
articles.content:
DPRK Government's Statement Distributed as UN General Assembly and UNSC Official Document
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government's statement, which exposes and condemns the illegality and barbarity of the UN Security Council's "sanctions resolution" No. 2371 cooked up by the U.S. and other hostile forces upset by the DPRK's measures for bolstering up the state nuclear force both in quality and quantity, was distributed as UN General Assembly and UNSC official document A/71/1011-S/2017/687 on Aug. 15.

articles.title: Joint Friendship Gathering of Participants in 5th International Festival in Praise of Great Persons of Mt Paektu
articles.content:
Joint Friendship Gathering of Participants in 5th International Festival in Praise of Great Persons of Mt Paektu
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A joint friendship gathering of the participants in the 5th International Festival in Praise of Great Persons of Mt Paektu took place at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street on Thursday.
					 Present there were Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairwoman of the Korean Preparatory Committee for the Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, and vice-chairpersons of the Korean Preparatory Committee and officials concerned.
					
					 On hand were lawmaker Madav Kumar Nepal who is former prime minister of Nepal and honorary chairman of the International Preparatory Committee for the Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, co-chairpersons and chairpersons of the international and regional preparatory committees and figures of various circles.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk said in her speech at the gathering that the 5th International Festival in Praise of Great Persons of Mt Paektu serves as a significant occasion as it demonstrated unanimous aspiration and will of humankind to accelerate the victorious advance for the cause of global independence, holding the peerlessly great persons in high esteem.
					
					 She expressed belief that the festival would further develop as a regular great meeting thanks to boundless reverence of the progressives.
					
					 A performance was given by Korean artistes there.
					
					 Its participants had diverse sports and amusement games.
					
					 Their dancing party revved up the festive atmosphere.

articles.title: Foreign Guests, Overseas Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Foreign Guests, Overseas Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the FUNCINPEC Party of Cambodia led by Vice-Chairman Chap Nhalyvoud, a delegation of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification led by Vice-Chairman Kang Thae Hwan and other foreign guests and overseas Koreans visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Thursday.
					 They paid homage to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues at the palace.
					
					 They paid tribute to the great leaders in the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 Then they went round the halls where the orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls which house the cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Participants in International Festival in Praise of Great Persons of Mt Paektu Visit Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
articles.content:
Participants in International Festival in Praise of Great Persons of Mt Paektu Visit Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 5th International Festival in Praise of the Great Persons of Mt Paektu Thursday visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum.
					 Being briefed on the fact that the army and people of the DPRK defeated the invasion by the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces and honorably defended the country's freedom and independence and gains of the revolution under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, they looked round various rooms.
					
					 They also toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, etc.

articles.title: Foreigners Visit Pyongyang Mission of AINDF
articles.content:
Foreigners Visit Pyongyang Mission of AINDF
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Dermot Hudson, chairman of the Korean Friendship Association UK, and his party and Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, who are participating in the 5th International Festival in Praise of the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, visited the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front (AINDF) on Thursday.
					 Chief Jo Il Min and members of the mission had a talk with them.
					
					 Jo expressed thanks for various progressive organizations for their brisk activities in positive support of the just struggle of the AINDF and south Korean people.
					
					 He stressed that the recent DPRK's successful second test-launch of ICBM Hwasong-14 serves as a historic event as it made a contribution to reliably defending the nation's dignity and sovereignty and ensuring peace and security on the Korean peninsula from the U.S. ever growing nuclear war threat.
					
					 Noting that the south Korean puppet authorities are hell-bent on confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north, going sycophantic towards the U.S. while vociferating about "closer alliance" with the U.S., he informed the visitors of the recent national reunification movement and peace actions against the U.S. and war waged by the south Korean people.
					
					 The chairmen of the British and Swiss bodies vehemently denounced the sanctions of the U.S. and south Korea to stifle the DPRK and their frantic war racket as extremely dangerous criminal acts as they drive the situation on the Korean peninsula into a catastrophic phase.
					
					 They expressed their will to denounce the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military maneuvers of the U.S. and puppet warmongers which aim at preemptive attack on the DPRK and further strengthen the activities for supporting the struggle of the south Korean people.

articles.title: Deputies to SPA Visit Mt Paektu and Taehongdan Area
articles.content:
Deputies to SPA Visit Mt Paektu and Taehongdan Area
Samjiyon, August 17 (KCNA) -- Deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK climbed the top of Mt Paektu on Aug. 17.
					 They looked at the mountain's scenery unparalleled and the wavy sea of emerald leaves.
					
					 On the same day, they went round the monument to the teachings on Mudu Peak, the secret camp on Mt Kanbaek, the secret camp on Mt Sono, etc.
					
					 Prior to the visits, they visited the area of Taehongdan.
					
					 They visited the Taehongdan Revolutionary Museum. 
					
					 They then went round the Sinsadong Revolutionary Battle Site where President Kim Il Sung did political work among people by leading the main force of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army on May 22, 1939 and advancing towards the Musan area.
					
					 They visited the Taehongdan Revolutionary Battle Site. 
					
					 They laid bouquets before the statue of the President at the Monument to the Victorious Battle in Musan Area and paid tribute to him.
					
					 They looked round Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station.
					
					 In the days of the study tour, they held a meeting for reciting long epic "Mt Paektu" and a contest in chorus singing revolutionary songs.

articles.title: Delegation of DPRK Olympic Committee Leaves to Participate in 29th World University Summer Games
articles.content:
Delegation of DPRK Olympic Committee Leaves to Participate in 29th World University Summer Games
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Olympic Committee led by Vice-Chairman Son Kwang Ho left here Thursday to participate in the 29th World University Summer Games (Universiad) to be held in Taipei of China as honorary guest.

articles.title: Delegation of DPRK University Sports Association Leaves for Chinese Taipei
articles.content:
Delegation of DPRK University Sports Association Leaves for Chinese Taipei
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK University Sports Association led by Chairman Jo Chol, vice-chairman of the Education Commission, left here Thursday to take part in the 29th World University Summer Games (Universiad) to be held in Taipei of China.

articles.title: DPRK Government's Statement Supported in Cities and Counties
articles.content:
DPRK Government's Statement Supported in Cities and Counties
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Mass rallies were held in cities and counties to hail the DPRK government's statement.
					 Present there were officials of local party and power organs, working people's organizations, industrial establishments and farms and working people, youth and students.
					
					 At the rallies, the statement of the DPRK government was read out before speeches.
					
					 The speakers expressed full support for the DPRK government's statement which solemnly declared it would make the U.S. pay for its hideous crimes against our state and people.
					
					 They scathingly denounced the UNSC "sanctions resolution" as a hideous unethical criminal document unprecedented in history which can be cooked up only by the U.S. barbarians working with bloodshot eyes to eliminate the DPRK, a socialist bulwark, from this planet.
					
					 They expressed their will to counter the "sanctions" with retaliation and "confrontation" with do-or-die resistance of justice now that the U.S. imperialists resort to all-round provocation in all fields of politics, economy and military affairs.
					
					 Then followed public processions.

articles.title: New Posters for Supporting DPRK Government's Statement Produced
articles.content:
New Posters for Supporting DPRK Government's Statement Produced
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- New posters were produced in the DPRK.
					 Poster "Let's make a great leap forward in building a socialist power, firmly holding the nuclear treasured-sword of Juche!" deals with the enthusiasm of the Korean people for the revolution and struggle to take a series of miracles astonishing the world in succession in building a socialist power with the might of self-reliance and self-development.
					
					 Poster "Let's demonstrate the independent dignity and might of nuclear power of Juche and the world's military power to the world!" reflects the great pride and self-confidence of the Korean army and people who met with the great auspicious event in the history of the nation and specially recorded event as the DPRK's overall national power and strategic position reached the highest level by the successful test-launch of ICBM.
					
					 Poster "Severe denunciation and categorical rejection!" visually represents the hatred and anger of the service personnel and people at the UNSC's "sanctions resolution" illegally cooked up by the U.S. and hostile forces.
					
					 Posters "Answer of Korea!" and "The whole U.S. mainland is in our striking range!" describe the unshakable resolution of the Korean army and people to wipe out the main bases of aggression with the DPRK's peculiar preemptive strike and bring a final victory in the confrontation with the U.S. the moment the U.S. reckless attempt at preemptive strike is detected.
					
					 Poster "Our road can never be checked!" shows the faith and spirit of all the service personnel and people to decisively smash the hostile forces' moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK and advance to the end straight along the road chosen by themselves.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued in DPRK
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK issued new stamps (five sheets) introducing the Natural History Museum.
					 The stamps show the exterior of the museum and the Universe Hall, Paleontology Hall, Animal Hall and the Botanical Hall in its interior.
					
					 The museum was opened in July Juche 105 (2016) as the peculiar scientific knowledge dissemination complex which gives people comprehensive knowledge of the history of the earth, the origin of life and organisms including animals and plants.
					
					 Meanwhile, four kinds of individual stamps were also published to picture magnolia, goshawk, Phungsan dog and pine tree which are the national flower, bird, dog and tree of Korea.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from General Association of Koreans in China
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from General Association of Koreans in China
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a letter from the General Association of Koreans in China on Aug. 15, the 72nd anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 The letter said that the General Association of Koreans in China pay high tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for achieving a great victory in the battles for liberating the country and laying lasting foundations for Korean revolution and offer the highest glory and warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un, who is leading to victory the cause of national independence with his Songun politics. 
					
					 It noted that the President built a new country where the people became masters for the first time in the nation's history spanning 5,000 years and registered a great victory in the Fatherland Liberation War, performing immortal revolutionary feats before the country, people, era and history.
					
					 It stated that Kim Jong Il, who inherited in its entirety the revolutionary cause of the President, firmly consolidated the country's war deterrent for self-defense with his Songun politics and scored a series of victories in the standoff with the U.S.-led imperialists, thus defending socialism centered on the masses.
					
					 It praised Kim Jong Un as the great Songun brilliant commander who has turned Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea into a nuclear power of Juche, a matchless military power and invincible socialist bulwark admired by the world with his indefatigable devotion, while invariably holding the great leaders' idea of attaching importance to the army and the military affairs.
					
					 The General Association of Koreans in China and all Koreans in China will wage a vigorous struggle to mercilessly foil the reckless provocations of the U.S. imperialists and war maniacs for a nuclear war targeting the north through the great unity of the whole nation and protect peace and security of the Korean peninsula and bring earlier a new morning of national reunification, the letter stressed.

articles.title: DPRK's Steps to Reinforce Nuclear Force Is Just Ones for Preventing Nuclear War: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK's Steps to Reinforce Nuclear Force Is Just Ones for Preventing Nuclear War: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's test-launch of ICBM Hwasong-14 is a stern warning to the U.S. spouting out a flurry of silly jargons to do harm to the DPRK, and its steps to reinforce the nuclear force are the just ones for self-defense in order to put a definite end to the U.S. persistent nuclear threat and blackmail against the DPRK and prevent a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a commentary. It goes on:
					
					 The DPRK's steps to bolster up nuclear deterrent touted by the U.S. and its vassal forces is not a threat to global peace and security but the U.S. reckless saber-rattling for nuclear war seriously getting on the nerves of our state is the threat to global peace and security.
					
					 The DPRK dignified with independence will never put the nuclear deterrent for self-defense on the negotiating table and flinch even an inch from the road of bolstering up the state nuclear force already chosen by itself.
					
					 It is no more than a declaration of war against the DPRK that the U.S. fabricated the unprecedented "sanctions resolution" which categorically cut off normal trade activities and economic exchange in the UN by branding the DPRK as the "force to wreck peace".
					
					 All service personnel and people of the DPRK will show their mettle if the U.S. dares ignite a war against the former.
					
					 If an order is issued, we will give vent to the pent-up wrath on the U.S. imperialists and wipe out the aggressors to the last one so that there would be no one left to sign a surrender document.
					
					 The U.S., chief criminal wrecking global peace and security and enemy common to mankind, would meet a miserable doom before long.

articles.title: Papers Term Heavyweights of S. Korean Puppet Ruling and Other Parties Despicable Political Philistines
articles.content:
Papers Term Heavyweights of S. Korean Puppet Ruling and Other Parties Despicable Political Philistines
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Heavyweights of the south Korean puppet ruling party and other political parties are unanimous in "welcoming" like a flock of crows the anti-DPRK "sanctions resolution" adopted at the UN Security Council shortly ago.
					 The ruling Minju Party let its spokesman make such impudent remarks praising the recent "sanctions resolution" as the "fixed will to the north" and "united warning" and calling for "a stop to reckless provocation". The "Kukmin Party" chimed in with it, calling in a commentary of its spokesman the resolution a "catalyst for the north's change", and urged the north to "opt for nuclear dismantlement".
					
					 The leading newspapers of the DPRK Thursday brand the political philistines as a group of traitors of the same stock.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun calls the puppet ruling and opposition parties the worst imbeciles and dirty political philistines going helter-skelter unaware of the strategic position of the DPRK that has towered as a world-level nuclear power and a military power, and the pitiful plight of their master that has faced a final ruin. It goes on:
					
					 The situation clearly proves that the south Korean politicians are pitiful poodle of the U.S. who can not but serve it, and that it is impossible to expect the improvement of the north-south relations as long as they are left intact.
					
					 The riff-raff of the puppet political circles will be made to poignantly experience the miserable results to be brought about by their light act of hastily supporting the U.S.-manipulated illegal "sanctions resolution" against the DPRK. 
					
					 Minju Joson says that the south Korean puppet political circles will face a miserable end just like the Park Geun Hye group of traitors due to be taken to the grave of history for getting hell-bent on escalating confrontation with the DPRK with the backing of the U.S.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Calling for "Tightened S. Korea-U.S. Alliance"
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Calling for "Tightened S. Korea-U.S. Alliance"
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Consultative Council for National Reconciliation issued a statement Thursday denouncing the south Korean authorities for going reckless while calling for "tightened south Korea-U.S. alliance".
					 At a time when the U.S. war hysteria against the DPRK has reached the height and the situation on the Korean peninsula has reached the worst phase, the south Korean authorities and the puppet military warmongers are calling for "tightening south Korea-U.S. alliance", the statement said, and went on:
					
					 This reckless act little short of adding fuel to nuclear war moves of the Trump group is indicative of the stupidity and sycophancy toward the U.S. by the puppet group.
					
					 The pledge to "strengthen south Korea-U.S. alliance" is a commitment to act as a shock brigade in the war of aggression against the north which the U.S. master plans to stage. This is little short of plunging south Korea into unheard-of horrible disaster of a nuclear war.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should choose between two things: war to be unleashed by "tightened south Korea-U.S. alliance" or the peace to be achieved by anti-U.S. struggle.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities defy the mindset of the public and the demand of the whole nation and keep to the humiliating sycophancy toward the U.S. while currying its favor, they will not be able to evade the sternest punishment by history.

articles.title: S. Korean Inhabitants Deny Results of Estimation of THAAD Impact on Environment
articles.content:
S. Korean Inhabitants Deny Results of Estimation of THAAD Impact on Environment
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Members of the Organization against THAAD and inhabitants in south Korea denied the estimation of THAAD impact on environment published by the puppet authorities, according to the south Korean paper Korea Economic Daily on Aug. 13. 
					 They said that the authorities failed to put forward the concrete method of measurement of THAAD electric wave and noise and include an expert recommended by inhabitants.
					
					 They denounced the estimation as an illegal act which ignored the procedure of democracy.
					
					 They urged the authorities to withdraw the illegally deployed THAAD pad and conduct the estimation of the impact on environment.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Demands Annulment of "Agreement" over Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Demands Annulment of "Agreement" over Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The foundation for preserving justice for the settlement of the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army in south Korea held a press conference for the annulment of 2015 south Korea-Japan agreement, disbandment of the foundation for reconciliation and recovery, redemption of one billion yen and announcement of fund-raising campaign among 1 million citizens. "
					 The speakers denounced the "government" for concluding the "agreement" over the sexual slavery issue with Japan which shunned the urgent cry of the victims.
					
					 They demanded the present authorities nullify the "agreement" and disband the "foundation for reconciliation and recovery".
					
					 They appealed to the citizens to take an active part in the fund-raising campaign to return one billion yen which the "government" got from the Japanese government, stressing that the authorities are reading the face of Japan over the sexual slavery issue.

articles.title: S. Korea Forms Death-Defying Corps to Check Authorities' Moves for Deploying Additional THAAD Launchers
articles.content:
S. Korea Forms Death-Defying Corps to Check Authorities' Moves for Deploying Additional THAAD Launchers
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Won Buddhists and inhabitants in south Korea formed a death-defying corps and entered into the struggle to check the authorities' moves to deploy additional THAAD launching pads in Sosong-ri, Chojon-myon, Songju County, North Kyongsang Province on Aug. 11, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The corps planned to conduct activities to check the introduction of construction equipment needed for additional THAAD launchers on the road and bridge outside the house of Sosong-ri village leading to site for THAAD deployment.

articles.title: August 15 All-people Action Staged in Seoul for Retaking Sovereignty and Realizing Peace on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
August 15 All-people Action Staged in Seoul for Retaking Sovereignty and Realizing Peace on Korean Peninsula
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The August 15 all-people rally for withdrawal of THAAD! stop to south Korea-U.S. joint military exercises and scraping of the agreement on the sexual slavery issue! was held at Seoul Square on August 15 under the sponsorship of the "committee for promoting the Aug. 15 all-people peace action to retake the sovereignty and realize the peace on the Korean peninsula," according to the south Korean Internet newspaper Tongil News. It comprises more than 200 civic organizations such as the Confederation of Trade Unions and the Solidarity for Progress. 
					More than 10,000 people of all strata including workers, farmers, the poor, women, youth and students were present at the rally.
					
					 At the rally, the speakers urged an immediate stop to the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military drills which the U.S. and the south Korean authorities are trying to conduct from August 21.
					
					 They demanded the U.S. abandon the hostile policy toward the DPRK and come out for dialogue and negotiations with it for normalizing relations with it and building a peace-keeping mechanism.
					
					 They denounced the present "government" for pushing forward the deployment of THAAD, the U.S. war monster, despite the opposition from various circles, and asserted that the society the candle light holders wanted was the one where the people are masters and the sovereignty is guaranteed, not the society pursued by the Park Geun Hye group of evils, subservient to the U.S. 
					
					After the rally, they marched in human-chains towards Kwanghwamun where the U.S. and Japanese embassies are situated upholding 10,000 red umbrellas depicting candlelight.

articles.title: International Bodies Denounce UN Security Council's Anti-DPRK "Sanctions Resolution"
articles.content:
International Bodies Denounce UN Security Council's Anti-DPRK "Sanctions Resolution"
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The representatives of the organizations for friendship and solidarity with the DPRK and international democratic organizations, taking part in the 5th  International Festival in Praise of the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, issued a joint statement here Thursday condemning the U.S. for cooking up the illegal anti-DPRK "sanctions resolution" by abusing the UN Security Council.
					 The statement said that the DPRK's measures for self-defence were just ones for defending the sovereignty of the country and the right to existence of the nation from the U.S. high-handed and arbitrary practices. It went on:
					
					 1. The U.S. has to withdraw all forms of sanctions against the DPRK and immediately stop all aggression war exercises, not resorting to indiscriminate and inhumanitarian sanctions.
					
					 Nothing can be settled by way of sanctions aimed at depriving the Koreans of their right to existence and at "overthrowing the social system" in the DPRK. Moreover, sanctions affecting the life of the peaceable citizens can never be justified.
					
					 We demand that the U.S. acknowledge the DPRK and opt for co-existing with it if the U.S. has a true intent to settle the issue of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 2. The U.S. should dismantle its nuclear weapons first, before taking issue with the DPRK's access to nuclear weapons and threatening the country with nukes.
					
					 It is a clear fact that the DPRK will never give up the nuclear deterrence for self-defence as long as there continues the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and nuclear threat to it, and the U.S. should show its efforts and sincerity for world peace and security before talking about nuclear issues of other countries.
					
					 We demand that the U.S., the world's biggest nuclear possessor, lend an ear to the international voices, fairly settle the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula and resolutely opt for denuclearizing the whole world.
					
					 3. The U.S. has to face up to the strategic position of the DPRK and finally withdraw its hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 It is a well-known fact that no one can deny that the DPRK has had access to ICBM along with a variety of nuclear weapons.
					
					 The U.S. has to admit that it is an anachronistic and extremely dangerous act to try to stifle and strangle the DPRK which has ranked itself among the world-level nuclear possessors and military powers, and take an immediate measure to make a switchover in its policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK Second Successful Test-launch of Hwasong-14 Events Hailed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK Second Successful Test-launch of Hwasong-14 Events Hailed Abroad
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A meeting, lecture and round-table talks were held in Nigeria, Ethiopia and Russia from Aug. 1 to 4 to congratulate the DPRK on its second successful test-launch of ICBM Hwasong-14.
					 Public figures of all social standings and citizens of those countries attended the events.
					
					 A professor of Nasarawa State University who is acting chairman of the Nigerian Group for Self-Reliance Studies said in a lecture:
					
					 The Korean people are strong in self-reliance and self-development as they redoubled their efforts to cope with the escalating pressure of foreign forces and gave full play to the spirit of self-reliance and fortitude under hard conditions.
					
					 Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un displayed the independent dignity and might of the DPRK once again before the world through the second test-launch of ICBM Hwasong-14.
					
					 A former member of the House of Representatives of Nigeria said that the world-startling historic events are auspicious ones to be celebrated not only by the Korean people but by other world progressives as great victories achieved with rare wisdom, matchless grit and outstanding leadership ability of respected HE Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The secretary of the Maritime Territory Nakhodka City Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation said that the DPRK was the only country, which is standing up against the U.S., firmly holding the socialist banner in the world.

articles.title: DPRK Is Sure to Win Final Victory in Confrontation with U.S.-led Imperialism: Nigerian Bodies
articles.content:
DPRK Is Sure to Win Final Victory in Confrontation with U.S.-led Imperialism: Nigerian Bodies
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- We are confident that the DPRK will surely win a final victory in the confrontation with U.S.-led imperialism by developing more strategic weapons with which it will demonstrate its invincible might before the world.
					The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Nigerian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy, the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Songun Politics and the Nigerian Group for Self-Reliance Studies said this in a joint statement on July 31.
					
					The statement warmly congratulated national defense scientists and people of the DPRK on having demonstrated the dignity and might of the nuclear power of Juche and the world's military power through the successful ICBM test-launch.
					
					Through the recent test-launch the DPRK demonstrated the capability to make a surprise launch of ICBM at any area and place at anytime and it was clearly proved that the whole U.S. mainland is in the striking range of the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful Test-launch of ICBM Lauded in Nepal
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful Test-launch of ICBM Lauded in Nepal
Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese magazines and newspapers hailed the DPRK's test-launch of ICBM as a contribution to the world peace from August 4 to 8. Their articles called for rolling back the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					 The Nepalese internet magazine Nepal Today in an article said that the thunder of the second test-launch of ICBM Hwasong-14 became the sound of a bell telling about the ruin of the American empire and the victory and defeat of the nuclear duel between the DPRK and the U.S. has already been decided when viewed objectively.
					
					 In an article titled "The whole U.S. mainland is in the striking range", the magazine stressed that the DPRK has already decided its last decisive battle with the U.S. and is trying to win the final victory in the U.S. mainland, not in the Korean peninsula, and that is why the U.S. is so afraid of the DPRK's ICBM.
					
					 The Nepalese newspaper Arpan said in an article that the DPRK's successful test-launch of ICBM serves as a contribution to the peace and stability, not threat to the world peace.
					
					 The newspaper in an article titled "The ever-victorious tradition of Songun Korea will be forever" said that the DPRK today has become a nuclear power in the East and the world's military power and its strategic position has fundamentally changed. It went on:
					
					 The tradition of victory of heroic Korea will lead to another miracle that the world people can never imagine.
					
					 The U.S. should abandon the anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. has no other way but to bend their knees before the Korean people and apologize.
					
					 The ever-victorious tradition of Songun Korea will be forever.

articles.title: Vocero del MINREX denuncia el nuevo "reporte" del Departamento de Estado
articles.content:
Vocero del MINREX denuncia el nuevo "reporte" del Departamento de Estado
Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- A la pregunta formulada por un reportero de la ACNC con respecto a que el Departamento de Estado norteamericano acuso a la RPDC en el recien publicado "reporte internacional de la libertad de religion de 2016", el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio hoy la siguiente respuesta:
					El Departamento de Estado de EE.UU. volvio a enumerar palabras calumniantes a la RPDC al publicar el dia 15 el llamado "reporte internacional de la libertad de religion de 2016" que evalua la situacion de esta libertad en todos los paises del mundo.
					
					La "libertad de religion", aludida por EE.UU., es condenada y rechazada por muchos paises del mundo porque no pasa de ser un medio para inventar pretextos de agresion e intervencion contra los Estados soberanos.
					
					No vale la pena discutir la acusacion de EE.UU. a la RPDC, repetida en el nuevo reporte. Es que esa es el esfuerzo agonico de quienes cayeron en el aprieto en el enfrentamiento politico-militar con la RPDC.
					
					Lo que no se puede tolerar jamas es la difamacion sobre la idea Juche, eterna guia directiva del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, y el regimen socialista que significa la vida para el pueblo coreano.
					
					El poderio nacional en general de nuestra patria y su posicion estrategica alcanzaron la nueva altura a pesar de la sancion y presion sin precedentes. Esta realidad es una manifestacion de la justeza y vitalidad de la gran idea Juche y el regimen socialista al estilo coreano.
					
					EE.UU. pagara muy caro sin falta sus actos provocadores que comete en todas las esferas, inclusive el tema de religion, cuando se ha tornado extremado el enfrentamiento RPDC-EE.UU.
					
					A EE.UU le convendria escuchar con seriedad la advertencia de no molestar mas a la RPDC absteniendose ahora mismo de sus insolentes actos provocadores y mandatos unilaterales.

articles.title: Comite de Juristas de Corea revela caracter ilegal de "resolucion de sancion" anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Comite de Juristas de Corea revela caracter ilegal de "resolucion de sancion" anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Comite de Juristas de Corea publico el dia 17 una declaracion revelando el caracter ilegal de la "resolucion de sancion" que invento EE.UU. abusando del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU bajo el pretexto del lanzamiento de prueba del cohete balistico intercontinental "Hwasong-14" de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					La fabricacion de esa resolucion, orientada a impedir completamente las normales actividades comerciales y el intercambio economico de la RPDC, deviene el crimen antietico que contraviene al parrafo 2 del articulo 1 del Convenio Internacional sobre Derechos Economico, Social y Cultural, que estipula no privar en ningun caso a un Estado soberano de los medios de su existencia, y a la norma perentoria reconocida internacionalmente, adelanta el documento y prosigue:
					
					Ni el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU puede ser una excepcion en la aplicacion de la norma perentoria.
					
					Sin embargo, ese aparato de la ONU vino inventando sistematicamente desde 2006 las "resoluciones de sancion" anti-RPDC que violan y suprimen nuestros derechos a sobrevivir y desarrollar.
					
					En particular, la "resolucion de sancion" No. 2371, fabricada bajo el pretexto del lanzamiento de prueba del ICBM de la RPDC, persigue impedir totalmente el desarrollo economico y el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida del pueblo, por lo cual resulta el acto criminal que contraviene fundamentalmente a la norma perentoria.
					
					El Articulo 53 de la Convencion de Viena sobre la Ley de Tratados estipula que "un tratado es invalido si contraviene a la norma perentoria".
					
					Esto demuestra evidentemente que son nulas todas las "resoluciones de sancion" anti-RPDC del Consejo de Seguridad que violaron y suprimieron sistematicamente nuestros derechos a sobrevivir y desarrollar.
					
					Deben ser invalidadas ahora mismo todas las "resoluciones de sancion" anti-RPDC, que ha inventado hasta ahora EE.UU. abusando del Consejo de Seguridad, y hay que pasar sin falta las cuentas de los crimenes cometidos contra nuestro Estado y pueblo.

articles.title: Portavoz de CRN condena el acto proyanqui de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Portavoz de CRN condena el acto proyanqui de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional de Corea publico el dia 17 una declaracion condenando a las autoridades surcoreanas que actuan imprudentemente hablando del "fortalecimiento de la alianza Sudcorea-EE.UU."
					Estos dias cuando se llega al climax la histeria belica de EE.UU. y la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana se inclina al estado gravisimo, las autoridades y los belicistas militares del Sur de Corea hablan ruidosamente de la necesidad del "fortalecimiento de la alianza Sudcorea-EE.UU.", senala el vocero y continua:
					
					Esta locura, que instiga mas las maniobras de la banda de Trump por provocar la guerra nuclear, muestra claramente la estupidez de las autoridades surcoreanas enloquecidas por el servilismo a EE.UU., condeno.
					
					El "fortalecimiento de la alianza Sudcorea-EE.UU." de que hablan ellos muestra el intento de servirse como brigada de la guerra de su amo gringo para la agresion al Norte (de Corea). Por tanto, esa locura traera solo el terrible desastre sin precedente de la guerra nuclear al Sur de Corea.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben tomar la clara opcion entre las dos: la guerra segun el "fortalecimiento de la alianza Sudcorea-EE.UU." o la paz segun la lucha antiyanqui.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas no podran evitar el castigo durisimo sin precedente en la historia si siguen recurriendo a la humillante sumision a EE.UU. dando espalda a la demanda de todos los sectores surcoreanos y el resto de la nacion.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a Joko Widodo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a Joko Widodo
Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 17 un mensaje de felicitacion a Joko Widodo, presidente de la Republica de Indonesia, en ocasion del aniversario 72 de la independencia de ese pais asiatico.
					En su misiva, el remitente expreso la conviccion de que tambien en el futuro se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion de larga historia entre los dos paises. Y formulo votos por mayores exitos en los trabajos del destinatario y el pueblo indonesio por lograr el desarrollo socio-economico y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita 57o aniversario de la independencia de Gabon
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita 57o aniversario de la independencia de Gabon
Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 17 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Gabon, Ali Bongo Ondimba, con motivo del aniversario 57 de la independencia del pais de Africa ecuatorial.
					Expresando la seguridad de que se consolidaran y se desarrollaran en varios sectores las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises que tienen larga historia, el remitente deseo mayores exitos en las tareas del destinatario por la estabilidad politica y la prosperidad socioeconomica del pais.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con participantes en festival internacional
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con participantes en festival internacional
Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 17 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con las personalidades extranjeras que participan en el V Festival Internacional de Homenaje a los Grandes Hombres del Monte Paektu.
					Entre ellas figuran el ex premier nepales, Madav Kumar Nepal, quien es parlamentario y presidente honorario del Comite Preparatorio Internacional para el Congreso de Elogio a los Grandes Hombres del Monte Paektu de 2017, y los copresidentes del mismo comite: Peter Woods, embajador de la Asociacion de Ciudades y Gobiernos Locales en la region de Asia-Pacifico, Damian Ogbonna, presidente nacional del Partido Progresivo del Pueblo de Nigeria, Helmi El Hadidi, presidente de la Organizacion de Solidaridad de los Pueblos Afro-Asiaticos, Fumihiro Himori, presidente del Comite Japones de Apoyo a la Reunificacion Independiente y Pacifica de Corea, Viktor Petrov, presidente de la Asociacion Rusa de Amistad y Cooperacion Cultural con la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Anders Kristensen, presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Dinamarca-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, vicepresidente del Partido Socialista Liberal de Egipto.
					
					En el encuentro se distinguian tambien otras personalidades de varios paises y regiones y las entidades democraticas internacionales.

articles.title: Sale de Pyongyang la delegacion de Asociacion Deportivo de Universitarios
articles.content:
Sale de Pyongyang la delegacion de Asociacion Deportivo de Universitarios
Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- Partio hoy de esta capital la delegacion de la Asociacion Deportivo de Universitarios de la RPDC, dirigida por su presidente Jo Chol, vicepresidente del Comite de Educacion, para tomar parte en la 29a Universiada Mundial de Verano que tendra lugar en Taipei China.

Parte la delegacion del Comite Olimpico para la 29a Universiada
Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- Salio hoy de esta capital la delegacion del Comite Olimpico de la RPDC, dirigida por su vicepresidente Son Kwang Ho, para participar en calidad de huesped honorario en la 29a Universiada Mundial de Verano que tendra lugar en Taipei China.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae recorre la Fabrica de Aparatos de Automatizacion de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae recorre la Fabrica de Aparatos de Automatizacion de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y del CC del PTC, averiguo en el terreno las gestiones de la Fabrica de Aparatos de Automatizacion de Pyongyang.
					Luego de pasar revista a la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria y la otra de presentacion del historial, el estimulo a los obreros que registran exitos innovadores en la produccion.
					
					En la reunion consultiva convocada en el terreno, se hizo enfasis en la importancia de la mision que asume la planta en remodelar el Samjiyon, distrito natal del Dirigente Kim Jong Il donde estan grabadas las huellas de resistencia antijaponesa del Presidente Kim Il Sung, como el prototipo y la tierra sagrada de la revolucion.
					
					Choe instruyo a los funcionarios, obreros y tecnicos de la fabrica trabajar con mas responsabilidad y dedicacion para producir y suministrar a tiempo las pizarras de distribucion electrica de diferentes tipos y otros aparatos necesarios a la obra mencionada.
